thanks Oliver,

with your advice in mind, I looked to the parameters table =
for ANJI and noticed that the default activation function to output neurons=
 is set "sigmoid". I set the parameter initial.topology.activation.output" =
to "linear" and it's working fine =3D)

regards,
Alisson Costa


--- In nea=
t@yahoogroups.com, Oliver Coleman <oliver.coleman@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Alliso=
n,
> 
> After a quick search of the ANJI source I found that this exception=
 is
> thrown in the *calculateErrorFitness* method in the *
> NeatTargetFit=
nessFunction* class in the *com.anji.neat* package (see source
> below).
> =

> This function calculates a fitness value based on the sum of the error o=
ver
> all responses (from the target response values). To calculate a fitne=
ss
> value (where bigger is better) from the error value (where smaller is
=
> better) this method needs to know what the maximum possible total error
>=
 value can be; it then subtracts the error value from the maximum error val=
ue
> to determine a fitness value.
> 
> To determine the maximum possible t=
otal error value it needs to know what
> the minimum and maximum value of i=
ndividual responses can be. So it looks
> like perhaps you haven't specifie=
d (somewhere or other) the correct *
> minResponse* and *maxResponse* value=
s as used by this method (or on the
> flip-side the responses produced by y=
our network are out of the range you
> have specified).
> 
> Cheers,
> Oliv=
er
> 
> /**
>  * Subtract <code>responses</code> from targets, sum all diff=
erences,
> subtract from max
>  * fitness, and square result.
>  *
>  * @pa=
ram responses output top be compared to targets
>  * @param minResponse
>  =
* @param maxResponse
>  * @return result of calculation
>  */
> protected i=
nt calculateErrorFitness( double[][] responses, double
> minResponse, doubl=
e maxResponse ) {
> double maxSumDiff =3D ErrorFunction.getInstance().getMa=
xError(
> getTargets().length * getTargets()[ 0 ].length,
> ( maxResponse -=
 minResponse ), SUM_OF_SQUARES );
> double maxRawFitnessValue =3D Math.pow(=
 maxSumDiff, 2 );
> 
> double sumDiff =3D ErrorFunction.getInstance().calcu=
lateError( getTargets(),
> responses, false );
> if ( sumDiff > maxSumDiff =
)
> throw new IllegalStateException( "sum diff > max sum diff" );
> double =
rawFitnessValue =3D Math.pow( maxSumDiff - sumDiff, 2 );
> double skewedFit=
ness =3D ( rawFitnessValue / maxRawFitnessValue ) *
> MAX_FITNESS;
> int re=
sult =3D (int) skewedFitness;
> return result;
> }
>
